title: How to Set, Reset, Remove and Recover the Password of Excel Files

steps.title: Click on the Office button, select Prepare, and then choose Encrypt Document
steps.content: Click on the Office button, select Prepare, and then choose Encrypt Document

steps.title: Enter a password in the Password box and then press OK.
steps.content: Enter a password in the Password box and then press OK.

steps.title: Re-enter the previous password to confirm and then press OK.
steps.content: Re-enter the previous password to confirm and then press OK.

steps.title: Save the password and the MS Excel 2007 document.
steps.content: Save the password and the MS Excel 2007 document. (Note: As Microsoft advises, you must not forget the password or you will not be able to get into the document. If you forget, you have to turn to third-party software like Excel password rescuer for help.)

steps.title: Click on the Office button-> Save as-> Tools on the right bottom of the Save as dialog box.
steps.content: Click on the Office button-> Save as-> Tools on the right bottom of the Save as dialog box.

steps.title: Click the Tools menu and choose General Options.
steps.content: Click the Tools menu and choose General Options.

steps.title: Type a password in the modifying password blank.
steps.content: Type a password in the modifying password blank.

steps.title: Retype the precious password in the blank and then press OK.
steps.content: Retype the precious password in the blank and then press OK.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save.

steps.title: Enter the password to open the spreadsheet.
steps.content: Enter the password to open the spreadsheet.

steps.title: Click on the Office button-> Prepare-> Encrypt Document.
steps.content: Click on the Office button-> Prepare-> Encrypt Document.

steps.title: Remove the punctiform password in Encrypt Document box and then click OK.
steps.content: Remove the punctiform password in Encrypt Document box and then click OK.

steps.title: Save the spreadsheet.
steps.content: Save the spreadsheet.

steps.title: Find an online password recovery service using query "password find online"
steps.content: Find an online password recovery service using query "password find online"

steps.title: Press the Unprotect your file button
steps.content: Press the Unprotect your file button

steps.title: Press the Browse button, select your protected spreadsheet and click Next Step
steps.content: Press the Browse button, select your protected spreadsheet and click Next Step

steps.title: Select recommended Remove password option
steps.content: Select recommended Remove password option

steps.title: Wait a few seconds while your password is being removed
steps.content: Wait a few seconds while your password is being removed

steps.title: If your file is small, it will be unprotected for free!
steps.content: If your file is small, it will be unprotected for free!

steps.title: For bigger files you’ll be able to see the first rows of all your spreadsheets.
steps.content: For bigger files you’ll be able to see the first rows of all your spreadsheets. To get the full document, you’ll need to enter the license key.

steps.title: Download Excel Password Rescuer and install it.
steps.content: Download Excel Password Rescuer and install it.

steps.title: Click Open and select the file of which the password is lost.
steps.content: Click Open and select the file of which the password is lost.

steps.title: Choose an attack type to recover Excel password.
steps.content: Choose an attack type to recover Excel password.

steps.title: Attack settings.
steps.content: Attack settings.

steps.title: Click Start on the left top.
steps.content: Click Start on the left top. When the operation is finished, you will recover the lost Excel password successfully.
